ygData.subject: Re: Levels after hell levels
ygData.msgSnippet: In the words of Conan Doyle, The Plot Thickens ...  For those of you who are unaware, DIKU Mud - was a popular MUD.  I m guessing that the code is available
ygData.messageBody:
In the words of Conan Doyle, "The Plot Thickens"... For those of you who
are unaware, DIKU Mud - was a popular MUD. I'm guessing that the code is
available in the Public Domain...

I don't recall Brad specifically saying that Hell Levels was unintentional
(I sure will take others word for it) - but I do recall him saying they were
common in MUDs.

It sure is beginning to appear that Verant "borrowed" (Diku?) MUD code and
it's in place in EQ. Whether intentional or not - Verant has made it clear
it's hear to stay...

Slyde


----- Original Message -----
From: "Adam Wasserman" <wassermana@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Thursday, February 24, 2000 2:21 PM
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Levels after hell levels


> From: "Adam Wasserman" <wassermana@...>
>
> I see what you're saying now.
>
> I still have to disagree though. Verant has stated, and recent
investigation
> seems to bear out their claims, that hell levels were not intended but are
a
> side effect of the exp formula. That being the case I find it highly
> unlikely that they have any code that says "Hell level + 1"
>
